entities.description: The state or process of being deprived of oxygen, which can result in unconsciousness or death; suffocation.
Instruments not categorized as traditional firearms, such as BB guns, pellet guns, Tasers, pepper spray, stun guns, etc.
Indicates the absence of specified items or conditions.
A portable gun such as a pistol or rifle.
A small gun designed to be held in one hand.
A long gun with a rifled barrel.
A firearm that is usually designed to be fired from the shoulder and uses the energy of a fixed shell to fire a number of small spherical pellets.
A blade or other instrument used for cutting.
An object with a rounded or flat end that can cause injury without cutting the skin.
Vehicles such as cars, trucks, and boats.
Body parts used as weapons, like hands, feet, and teeth.
A substance that is capable of causing the illness or death of a living organism when introduced or absorbed.
Substances that can cause explosions, such as bombs.
Substances used for medication or recreational purposes that impact mental state or bodily functions.

relationships.description: Indicates that a firearm was used in an incident.
Indicates that a handgun was used in an incident.
Indicates that a rifle was used in an incident.
Indicates that a shotgun was used in an incident.
Indicates that other types of weapons were used in an incident.
Indicates that a knife or cutting instrument was used in an incident.
Indicates that a blunt object was used in an incident.
Indicates that a substance was used to cause asphyxiation.
Indicates that a substance was used as poison.
Indicates that a substance was used as explosives.
Indicates that a substance was used as a fire or incendiary device.
Indicates that a substance was used as drugs, narcotics, or sleeping pills.
